Questions.QuestionText:
x=[i for i in range(10)] 
 x will hold:
Answers: a list of all integers between 1 and 10
a list of all integers between 0 and 9
a list of all numbers between 0 and 10
a list of 10 'i's

Questions.QuestionText:
x=sum([i for i in range(10) if i%2==0]) 
 x will hold:
Answers: the sum of all numbers between 1 and 10
the sum of all even numbers between 1 and 10
the sum of all numbers between 0 and 9
the sum of all even numbers between 0 and 9

Questions.QuestionText:
x=[] 
 for i in range(1,51): 
 	 x.append(i*5) 
 is equivalent to:
Answers: x=[i for i*5 in range(1,51)]
x=[i*5 for i in range(1,51)]
x=[5 for i in range(1,51)]
x=[5i for i in range(1,51)]

Questions.QuestionText:
x=[1] 
 for i in range(2,51): 
 	 x.append(i*x[-1]) 
 x will hold:
Answers: a list of all the squares of integers between 1 and 50
a list of all the factorials of integers between 1 and 50
a list of all integers between 1 and 50
The programme will crash

Questions.QuestionText:
print(sum([j**2 for j in range(100) if len(str(j))==2])) 
 Prints:
Answers: a list of all the squares of 2 digit integers
a list of all the squares of integers between 0 and 100
the sum of all the squares of 2 digit integers
the sum of all the squares of integers between 0 and 100

Questions.QuestionText:
x=[5*str(i) for i in range(1,10)] 
 x will hold:
Answers: a list of the first 9 multiples of 5 as integers
a list of the first 9 multiples of 5 as strings
a list of the first 9 iterations of the pattern: '11111','22222','33333'...
a list of the first 9 iterations of the pattern: '00000','11111','22222'...

Questions.QuestionText:
x=[[i*j for j in range(1,10)] for i in range(1,100)] 
 x will hold
Answers: a list of lists of the first 9 multiples of the first 99 integers
a list of lists of the first 99 multiples of the first 9 integers
a list of lists of the first 10 multiples of the first 100 integers
a list of lists of the first 100 multiples of the first 10 integers
